trans-unit.source: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to create and manage volume groups | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to create and manage volume groups | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager MMC snap-in to create and manage volume groups.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager MMC snap-in to create and manage volume groups.

trans-unit.source: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to create and manage volume groups
trans-unit.target: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to create and manage volume groups

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the **Volume Groups** node on the **Scope** pane to assign volumes to volume groups, view information about a volume group, schedule backups, and edit volume groups.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **Volume Groups** node on the **Scope** pane to assign volumes to volume groups, view information about a volume group, schedule backups, and edit volume groups.

trans-unit.source: Volume groups are pools of related volumes used to ensure that backups are application-consistent.
trans-unit.target: Volume groups are pools of related volumes used to ensure that backups are application-consistent.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Volumes and volume groups](storsimple-what-is-snapshot-manager.md#volumes-and-volume-groups) and [Integration with Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service](storsimple-what-is-snapshot-manager.md#integration-with-windows-volume-shadow-copy-service).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Volumes and volume groups](storsimple-what-is-snapshot-manager.md#volumes-and-volume-groups) and [Integration with Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service](storsimple-what-is-snapshot-manager.md#integration-with-windows-volume-shadow-copy-service).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] When you configure volume groups, do not mix cluster-shared volumes (CSVs) and non-CSVs in the same volume group.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] When you configure volume groups, do not mix cluster-shared volumes (CSVs) and non-CSVs in the same volume group.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager does not support a mix of CSVs and non-CSVs in the same snapshot.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager does not support a mix of CSVs and non-CSVs in the same snapshot.

trans-unit.source: Volume groups node
trans-unit.target: Volume groups node

trans-unit.source: Figure 1: StorSimple Snapshot Manager Volume Groups node
trans-unit.target: Figure 1: StorSimple Snapshot Manager Volume Groups node

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how you can use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how you can use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to:

trans-unit.source: View information about your volume groups
trans-unit.target: View information about your volume groups

trans-unit.source: Create a volume group
trans-unit.target: Create a volume group

trans-unit.source: Back up a volume group
trans-unit.target: Back up a volume group

trans-unit.source: Edit a volume group
trans-unit.target: Edit a volume group

trans-unit.source: Delete a volume group
trans-unit.target: Delete a volume group

trans-unit.source: All of these actions are also available on the **Actions** pane.
trans-unit.target: All of these actions are also available on the **Actions** pane.

trans-unit.source: View volume groups
trans-unit.target: View volume groups

trans-unit.source: If you click the **Volume Groups** node, the **Results** pane shows the following information about each volume group, depending on the column selections you make.
trans-unit.target: If you click the **Volume Groups** node, the **Results** pane shows the following information about each volume group, depending on the column selections you make.

trans-unit.source: (The columns in the **Results** pane are configurable.
trans-unit.target: (The columns in the **Results** pane are configurable.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the **Volumes** node, select **View**, and then select **Add/Remove Columns**.)
trans-unit.target: Right-click the **Volumes** node, select **View**, and then select **Add/Remove Columns**.)

trans-unit.source: Results column
trans-unit.target: Results column

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: The **Name** column contains the name of the volume group.
trans-unit.target: The **Name** column contains the name of the volume group.

trans-unit.source: Application
trans-unit.target: Application

trans-unit.source: The **Applications** column shows the number of VSS writers currently installed and running on the Windows host.
trans-unit.target: The **Applications** column shows the number of VSS writers currently installed and running on the Windows host.

trans-unit.source: Selected
trans-unit.target: Selected

trans-unit.source: The **Selected** column shows the number of volumes that are contained in the volume group.
trans-unit.target: The **Selected** column shows the number of volumes that are contained in the volume group.

trans-unit.source: A zero (0) indicates that no application is associated with the volumes in the volume group.
trans-unit.target: A zero (0) indicates that no application is associated with the volumes in the volume group.

trans-unit.source: Imported
trans-unit.target: Imported

trans-unit.source: The **Imported** column shows the number of imported volumes.
trans-unit.target: The **Imported** column shows the number of imported volumes.

trans-unit.source: When set to **True**, this column indicates that a volume group was imported from the Microsoft Azure Management Portal and was not created in StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: When set to **True**, this column indicates that a volume group was imported from the Microsoft Azure Management Portal and was not created in StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] StorSimple Snapshot Manager volume groups are also displayed on the **Backup Policies** tab in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] StorSimple Snapshot Manager volume groups are also displayed on the **Backup Policies** tab in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Create a volume group
trans-unit.target: Create a volume group

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to create a volume group.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to create a volume group.

trans-unit.source: To create a volume group
trans-unit.target: To create a volume group

trans-unit.source: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the **Scope** pane, right-click **Volume Groups**, and then click **Create Volume Group**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Scope** pane, right-click **Volume Groups**, and then click **Create Volume Group**.

trans-unit.source: Create volume group
trans-unit.target: Create volume group

trans-unit.source: The **Create a volume group** dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Create a volume group** dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: Create a volume group dialog
trans-unit.target: Create a volume group dialog

trans-unit.source: Enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: In the **Name** box, type a unique name for the new volume group.
trans-unit.target: In the **Name** box, type a unique name for the new volume group.

trans-unit.source: In the **Applications** box, select applications associated with the volumes that you will be adding to the volume group.
trans-unit.target: In the **Applications** box, select applications associated with the volumes that you will be adding to the volume group.

trans-unit.source: The **Applications** box lists only those applications that use Azure StorSimple volumes and have VSS writers enabled for them.
trans-unit.target: The **Applications** box lists only those applications that use Azure StorSimple volumes and have VSS writers enabled for them.

trans-unit.source: A VSS writer is enabled only if all the volumes that the writer is aware of are Azure StorSimple volumes.
trans-unit.target: A VSS writer is enabled only if all the volumes that the writer is aware of are Azure StorSimple volumes.

trans-unit.source: If the Applications box is empty, then no applications that use Azure StorSimple volumes and have supported VSS writers are installed.
trans-unit.target: If the Applications box is empty, then no applications that use Azure StorSimple volumes and have supported VSS writers are installed.

trans-unit.source: (Currently, Azure StorSimple supports Microsoft Exchange and SQL Server.) For more information about VSS writers, see [Integration with Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service](storsimple-what-is-snapshot-manager.md#integration-with-windows-volume-shadow-copy-service).
trans-unit.target: (Currently, Azure StorSimple supports Microsoft Exchange and SQL Server.) For more information about VSS writers, see [Integration with Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service](storsimple-what-is-snapshot-manager.md#integration-with-windows-volume-shadow-copy-service).

trans-unit.source: If you select an application, all volumes associated with it are automatically selected.
trans-unit.target: If you select an application, all volumes associated with it are automatically selected.

trans-unit.source: Conversely, if you select volumes associated with a specific application, the application is automatically selected in the **Applications** box.
trans-unit.target: Conversely, if you select volumes associated with a specific application, the application is automatically selected in the **Applications** box.

trans-unit.source: In the **Volumes** box, select Azure StorSimple volumes to add to the volume group.
trans-unit.target: In the **Volumes** box, select Azure StorSimple volumes to add to the volume group.

trans-unit.source: You can include volumes with single or multiple partitions.
trans-unit.target: You can include volumes with single or multiple partitions.

trans-unit.source: (Multiple partition volumes can be dynamic disks or basic disks with multiple partitions.) A volume that contains multiple partitions is treated as a single unit.
trans-unit.target: (Multiple partition volumes can be dynamic disks or basic disks with multiple partitions.) A volume that contains multiple partitions is treated as a single unit.

trans-unit.source: Consequently, if you add only one of the partitions to a volume group, all the other partitions are automatically added to that volume group at the same time.
trans-unit.target: Consequently, if you add only one of the partitions to a volume group, all the other partitions are automatically added to that volume group at the same time.

trans-unit.source: After you add a multiple partition volume to a volume group, the multiple partition volume continues to be treated as a single unit.
trans-unit.target: After you add a multiple partition volume to a volume group, the multiple partition volume continues to be treated as a single unit.

trans-unit.source: You can create empty volume groups by not assigning any volumes to them.
trans-unit.target: You can create empty volume groups by not assigning any volumes to them.

trans-unit.source: Do not mix cluster-shared volumes (CSVs) and non-CSVs in the same volume group.
trans-unit.target: Do not mix cluster-shared volumes (CSVs) and non-CSVs in the same volume group.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager does not support a mix of CSV volumes and non-CSV volumes in the same snapshot.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager does not support a mix of CSV volumes and non-CSV volumes in the same snapshot.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to save the volume group.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to save the volume group.

trans-unit.source: Back up a volume group
trans-unit.target: Back up a volume group

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to back up a volume group.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to back up a volume group.

trans-unit.source: To back up a volume group
trans-unit.target: To back up a volume group

trans-unit.source: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the **Scope** pane, expand the **Volume Groups** node, right-click a volume group name, and then click **Take Backup**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Scope** pane, expand the **Volume Groups** node, right-click a volume group name, and then click **Take Backup**.

trans-unit.source: Back up volume group immediately
trans-unit.target: Back up volume group immediately

trans-unit.source: In the **Take Backup** dialog box, select **Local Snapshot** or **Cloud Snapshot**, and then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Take Backup** dialog box, select **Local Snapshot** or **Cloud Snapshot**, and then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Take backup dialog
trans-unit.target: Take backup dialog

trans-unit.source: To confirm that the backup is running, expand the **Jobs** node, and then click **Running**.
trans-unit.target: To confirm that the backup is running, expand the **Jobs** node, and then click **Running**.

trans-unit.source: The backup should be listed.
trans-unit.target: The backup should be listed.

trans-unit.source: To view the completed snapshot, expand the **Backup Catalog** node, expand the volume group name, and then click **Local Snapshot** or **Cloud Snapshot**.
trans-unit.target: To view the completed snapshot, expand the **Backup Catalog** node, expand the volume group name, and then click **Local Snapshot** or **Cloud Snapshot**.

trans-unit.source: The backup will be listed if it finished successfully.
trans-unit.target: The backup will be listed if it finished successfully.

trans-unit.source: Edit a volume group
trans-unit.target: Edit a volume group

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to edit a volume group.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to edit a volume group.

trans-unit.source: To edit a volume group
trans-unit.target: To edit a volume group

trans-unit.source: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the **Scope** pane, expand the **Volume Groups** node, right-click a volume group name, and then click **Edit**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Scope** pane, expand the **Volume Groups** node, right-click a volume group name, and then click **Edit**.

trans-unit.source: The **Create a volume group **dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Create a volume group **dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: You can change the **Name**, **Applications**, and **Volumes** entries.
trans-unit.target: You can change the **Name**, **Applications**, and **Volumes** entries.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to save your changes.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to save your changes.

trans-unit.source: Delete a volume group
trans-unit.target: Delete a volume group

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to delete a volume group.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to delete a volume group.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] This also deletes all backups associated with the volume group.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] This also deletes all backups associated with the volume group.

trans-unit.source: To delete a volume group
trans-unit.target: To delete a volume group

trans-unit.source: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the **Scope** pane, expand the **Volume Groups** node, right-click a volume group name, and then click **Delete**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Scope** pane, expand the **Volume Groups** node, right-click a volume group name, and then click **Delete**.

trans-unit.source: The **Delete Volume Group** dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Delete Volume Group** dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: Type **Confirm** in the text box, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Type **Confirm** in the text box, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: The deleted volume group vanishes from the list in the **Results** pane and all backups that are associated with that volume group are deleted from the backup catalog.
trans-unit.target: The deleted volume group vanishes from the list in the **Results** pane and all backups that are associated with that volume group are deleted from the backup catalog.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: [Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to create and manage backup policies](storsimple-snapshot-manager-manage-backup-policies.md).
